author: Special Correspondent
text:
India Post has introduced Automated Teller Machine (ATM) service at the Head Post-office here. The district falls under the Srirangam postal division. This is the first ATM service by the postal department in the district and third in the Srirangam division.

Collector K. Nandakumar inaugurated the ATM service and appealed to the savings bank account holders to take maximum advantage.

P. Michaelraj, Divisional Superintendent of Post Offices, Srirangam, said that as many as 11,683 savings bank account holders in Perambalur would benefit from the ATM service. The ATM ranked 88th in Tamil Nadu circle and 22nd in the Central region. Presently, only post office account-holders could withdraw money from this ATM and it had been planned to accept ATM cards of other banks too in course of time. India Post had planned to introduce various services at the post office.

Earlier, the Collector pasted the stickers on voting on the Automated Teller Machine.
title: Postal ATM service inaugurated
